Elements.Text: Get a beautiful  static HTML  website and turn it into a template

### Setup solution
- Ensure you have 'wedit' tool installed on your working environment
- Create a working folder: _<site>_ 
- Within the working folder run: _wedit init_
- Put your HTML template into folder: _<site>/template/_
- Modify the template by adding attributes: _data-var_

### Template structure
- Each page in your template must have own sub-folder that is to be mapped to the request URL
- All HTML templates must be located within the corresponding sub-folders and be named index.html

For example URL: http://<your_site>/something/here will hit template <site>/something/here/index.html

### data-var= 'key '
- In your template index.html add data-var= '<key> ' attribute to any item you want to be able to edit.
- The <key> must be unique for the page.

### data-var-repeat= '<key> '
- In your template index.html add data-var-repeat= 'key ' for all items you want to be repeatable.
- The <key> must be unique for the page

### Adding multiple pages per template
Just get the Wedit tool on your MAC, Windows or Linux machine

You can install Wedit tool using:

- Brew for MAC: _brew install wedit_
- Scoop for Windows: _scoop install wedit_
- Even though we don't recommend it, you can get [direct binaries] for your operating system
- Or compile your own version from our [Git repository](https://github.com/sofmon/wedit) using [Go](https://golang.org/) and [Dart](https://www.dartlang.org/)

The tool is statically compiled so once you have it working there is no needs for any external dependencies.
Seeing is believing: Press the 'ctrl' key and edit this page

Wedit is a static site generation tool that is using the web browser as a WYSIWYG HTML editor based on user defined HTML template.

Wedit is an Open Source project under MIT license. We believe you have the right to know what is running on your machines.

You are more than welcome to contribute. Fork us on [github](https://github.com/sofmon/wedit) and get wild.

[Sofmon](https://www.sofmon.com) is the hub for all software monsters.

You can find other projects like Wedit or blogs of the monsters.

This website uses the Wedit tool for its generation.

The web browser editor, as part of Wedit tool, is also included into this static website in order to show of the WYSIWYG editing.

In usual setup the Wedit WYSIWYG editor is not part of your HTML.
